title: Personal Branding: Define, Express, and Scale Your Professional Identity
description:
Master personal branding from first principles to thought leadership with guidance from world-class experts. This course features professors from Harvard, Stanford, and Wharton; practitioners who built brands at Apple and Bloomberg; and bestselling authors with 100+ books combined.

Beginner level establishes foundations: Learn what personal branding is from a Harvard Business School marketing professor, understand the psychology of authenticity from Dr. Brené Brown's 20 years of vulnerability research, discover your purpose with Simon Sinek's 'Start With Why' framework, master modern digital tactics from 5-time NYT bestselling entrepreneur Gary Vaynerchuk, learn strategic marketing thinking from Seth Godin (18 bestselling books), and build communication fundamentals with Dianna Booher (author of 48 books, 'the communication guru of the 21st century').

Intermediate level focuses on application: Apply vulnerability to workplace contexts with Brené Brown and Wharton's top-rated professor Adam Grant in an expert-to-expert conversation, understand how work culture shapes professional identity with Adam Grant's organizational psychology expertise, learn storytelling techniques from master storyteller Matthew Dicks (whose stories 'win million-dollar deals and turn skeptical investors into champions'), discover story patterns from Nancy Duarte (who helped Al Gore tell 'An Inconvenient Truth' and has 'cracked the code' of business storytelling), master career reinvention with Dorie Clark's Harvard Business Review-published framework from her book 'Reinventing You,' and build executive presence using Dr. Laura Camacho's neuroscience-backed strategies from her Executive Presence Mastery program.

Advanced level teaches scaling: Build authority and thought leadership with Rusty Shelton (founder of Zilker Media, author of 'The Authority Advantage'), learn brand evangelism from Guy Kawasaki (former Apple Chief Evangelist under Steve Jobs, who pioneered evangelism marketing in the 1980s), manage reputation with Stanford lecturer Alison Kluger's industry-tested strategic communication frameworks, understand the behavioral science of influence from Daniel Pink's research (bestselling author of 'Drive' and 'To Sell is Human,' former VP Al Gore speechwriter, TED talk in top 10 most-watched), lead at scale with insights from Chuck Garcia (Michael Bloomberg's executive coach and leadership communication expert), and master crisis management with Bill Coletti's 25+ years handling high-stakes Fortune 500 situations (author of 'Critical Moments: The New Mindset of Reputation Management').

This isn't a collection of motivational talks—it's a research-backed, practitioner-validated, systematically progressive course from recognized authorities who've built, studied, and taught personal branding at the highest levels. Every episode features credentialed expert interviews from 18 different podcasts including Harvard Business Review, TED's ReThinking with Adam Grant, The Knowledge Project, Smart Passive Income, and specialized shows focused on authority-building, crisis management, and executive presence. Every concept builds logically from understanding your brand (beginner) to communicating it strategically (intermediate) to scaling your influence as a thought leader (advanced).
